document.comment: Generated automatically from Godot engine sources.

section.title: OptionButton
section.paragraph: A button that brings up a dropdown with selectable options when pressed.

section.title: Description
section.paragraph: OptionButton is a type of button that brings up a dropdown with selectable items when pressed. The item selected becomes the "current" item and is displayed as the button text.
See also BaseButton which contains common properties and methods associated with this node.
Note: The IDs used for items are limited to signed 32-bit integers, not the full 64 bits of int. These have a range of -2^31 to 2^31 - 1, that is, -2147483648 to 2147483647.
Note: The Button.text and Button.icon properties are set automatically based on the selected item. They shouldn't be changed manually.

entry.paragraph: add_icon_item(texture: Texture2D, label: String, id: int = -1)

section.title: Signals
section.paragraph: item_focused(index: int) ðŸ”—
Emitted when the user navigates to an item using the ProjectSettings.input/ui_up or ProjectSettings.input/ui_down input actions. The index of the item selected is passed as argument.
item_selected(index: int) ðŸ”—
Emitted when the current item has been changed by the user. The index of the item selected is passed as argument.
allow_reselect must be enabled to reselect an item.

section.title: Property Descriptions
section.paragraph: bool allow_reselect = false ðŸ”—
If true, the currently selected item can be selected again.
bool fit_to_longest_item = true ðŸ”—
If true, minimum size will be determined by the longest item's text, instead of the currently selected one's.
Note: For performance reasons, the minimum size doesn't update immediately when adding, removing or modifying items.
int item_count = 0 ðŸ”—
The number of items to select from.
int selected = -1 ðŸ”—
The index of the currently selected item, or -1 if no item is selected.

section.title: Method Descriptions
section.paragraph: void add_icon_item(texture: Texture2D, label: String, id: int = -1) ðŸ”—
Adds an item, with a texture icon, text label and (optionally) id. If no id is passed, the item index will be used as the item's ID. New items are appended at the end.
Note: The item will be selected if there are no other items.
void add_item(label: String, id: int = -1) ðŸ”—
Adds an item, with text label and (optionally) id. If no id is passed, the item index will be used as the item's ID. New items are appended at the end.
Note: The item will be selected if there are no other items.
void add_separator(text: String = "") ðŸ”—
Adds a separator to the list of items. Separators help to group items, and can optionally be given a text header. A separator also gets an index assigned, and is appended at the end of the item list.
void clear() ðŸ”—
Clears all the items in the OptionButton.
AutoTranslateMode get_item_auto_translate_mode(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the auto translate mode of the item at index idx.
Texture2D get_item_icon(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the icon of the item at index idx.
int get_item_id(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the ID of the item at index idx.
int get_item_index(id: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the index of the item with the given id.
Variant get_item_metadata(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Retrieves the metadata of an item. Metadata may be any type and can be used to store extra information about an item, such as an external string ID.
String get_item_text(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the text of the item at index idx.
String get_item_tooltip(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the tooltip of the item at index idx.
PopupMenu get_popup() const ðŸ”—
Returns the PopupMenu contained in this button.
Warning: This is a required internal node, removing and freeing it may cause a crash. If you wish to hide it or any of its children, use their Window.visible property.
int get_selectable_item(from_last: bool = false) const ðŸ”—
Returns the index of the first item which is not disabled, or marked as a separator. If from_last is true, the items will be searched in reverse order.
Returns -1 if no item is found.
int get_selected_id() const ðŸ”—
Returns the ID of the selected item, or -1 if no item is selected.
Variant get_selected_metadata() const ðŸ”—
Gets the metadata of the selected item. Metadata for items can be set using set_item_metadata().
bool has_selectable_items() const ðŸ”—
Returns true if this button contains at least one item which is not disabled, or marked as a separator.
bool is_item_disabled(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns true if the item at index idx is disabled.
bool is_item_separator(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns true if the item at index idx is marked as a separator.
void remove_item(idx: int) ðŸ”—
Removes the item at index idx.
void select(idx: int) ðŸ”—
Selects an item by index and makes it the current item. This will work even if the item is disabled.
Passing -1 as the index deselects any currently selected item.
void set_disable_shortcuts(disabled: bool) ðŸ”—
If true, shortcuts are disabled and cannot be used to trigger the button.
void set_item_auto_translate_mode(idx: int, mode: AutoTranslateMode) ðŸ”—
Sets the auto translate mode of the item at index idx.
Items use Node.AUTO_TRANSLATE_MODE_INHERIT by default, which uses the same auto translate mode as the OptionButton itself.
void set_item_disabled(idx: int, disabled: bool) ðŸ”—
Sets whether the item at index idx is disabled.
Disabled items are drawn differently in the dropdown and are not selectable by the user. If the current selected item is set as disabled, it will remain selected.
void set_item_icon(idx: int, texture: Texture2D) ðŸ”—
Sets the icon of the item at index idx.
void set_item_id(idx: int, id: int) ðŸ”—
Sets the ID of the item at index idx.
void set_item_metadata(idx: int, metadata: Variant) ðŸ”—
Sets the metadata of an item. Metadata may be of any type and can be used to store extra information about an item, such as an external string ID.
void set_item_text(idx: int, text: String) ðŸ”—
Sets the text of the item at index idx.
void set_item_tooltip(idx: int, tooltip: String) ðŸ”—
Sets the tooltip of the item at index idx.
void show_popup() ðŸ”—
Adjusts popup position and sizing for the OptionButton, then shows the PopupMenu. Prefer this over using get_popup().popup().

section.title: Theme Property Descriptions
section.paragraph: int arrow_margin = 4 ðŸ”—
The horizontal space between the arrow icon and the right edge of the button.
int modulate_arrow = 0 ðŸ”—
If different than 0, the arrow icon will be modulated to the font color.
The arrow icon to be drawn on the right end of the button.

This method has no side effects. It doesn't modify any of the instance's member variables.
This method accepts any number of arguments after the ones described here.
This method is used to construct a type.
